mn124:3.2: At one time Venerable Bakkula was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
mn124:3.3: Then the naked ascetic Kassapa, who had been a friend of Bakkula’s in the lay life, approached him,
mn124:3.5: When the greetings and polite conversation were over, he sat down to one side,
mn124:4.1: “Reverend Bakkula, how long has it been since you went forth?”
mn124:4.3: “But in these eighty years, how many times have you had sex?”
mn124:4.4: “You shouldn’t ask me such a question.
mn124:4.6: Rather, you should ask me this:
mn124:4.7: ‘But in these eighty years, how many times have sensual perceptions ever arisen in you?’”
mn124:4.8: “But in these eighty years, how many times have sensual perceptions ever arisen in you?”
mn124:5.1: “In these eighty years, I don’t recall that any perception of sensuality has ever arisen in me.”
mn124:5.2: “This we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:6.1: “In these eighty years, I don’t recall that any perception of ill will …
mn124:6.3: or cruelty has ever arisen in me.”
mn124:6.4: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:7.1: “In these eighty years, I don’t recall that any thought of sensuality …
mn124:8.3: or cruelty has ever arisen in me.”
mn124:8.4: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:9.1: “In these eighty years, I don’t recall accepting a robe from a householder …
mn124:10.1: cutting a robe with a knife …
mn124:11.1: sewing a robe with a needle …
mn124:11.5: looking for robe material for my companions in the spiritual life when they are making robes …
mn124:11.11: getting caught up in the details of female’s appearance …
mn124:11.12: teaching a female, even so much as a four line verse …
mn124:11.20: being looked after by a novice …
mn124:11.23: looking for a massage from my companions in the spiritual life …
mn124:11.24: ever being ill, even as long as it takes to pull a cow’s udder …
mn124:11.25: being presented with medicine, even as much as a bit of yellow myrobalan …
mn124:11.28: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:12.1: “In these eighty years, I don’t recall entering the rainy season residence in a village district.”
mn124:12.2: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:13.1: “Reverend, for seven days I ate the nation’s alms-food as a debtor.
mn124:13.2: Then on the eight day I became enlightened.”
mn124:13.3: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:14.1: “Reverend Bakkula, may I receive the going forth, the ordination in this teaching and training?”
mn124:14.2: And the naked ascetic Kassapa received the going forth, the ordination in this teaching and training.
mn124:14.3: Not long after his ordination, Venerable Kassapa, living alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined, soon
mn124:14.4: realized the supreme end of the spiritual path in this very life. He lived having achieved with his own insight the goal for which people from good families rightly go forth from the lay life to homelessness.
mn124:14.6: He understood: “Rebirth is ended; the spiritual life has been lived; what had to be done has been done; there is no return to any state of existence.”
mn124:14.7: And Venerable Kassapa became one of the perfected.
mn124:15.1: Then some time later Venerable Bakkula took a key and went from dwelling to dwelling, saying:
mn124:15.3: Today will be my final extinguishment.”
mn124:15.4: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
mn124:16.1: And Venerable Bakkula became finally extinguished while sitting right in the middle of the Saṅgha.
mn124:16.2: “This too we remember as an incredible quality of Venerable Bakkula.”
